div.h1: Coronavirus (Covid-19) | School Closure Updates and Educational Resources

span.span: Coronavirus (Covid-19) | School Closure Updates and Educational Resources

div.span: Coronavirus (Covid-19) | School Closure Updates and Educational Resources

div.h2: Effective Immediately EEACS has transitioned all classes (Elementary, Middle and High Schools) to online instruction indefinitely.
div.p: Executive Eduction Academy Charter School has no known cases of coronavirus (COVID-19) at this time, but there are positive cases in Pennsylvania. As this is an evolving situation, please check the PA Department of Health for the most updated information related to the Commonwealth of PA.
This webpage serves as the hub for information for members of the EEACS community who have questions about the pandemic outbreak, and updates on the education and wellness of EEACS.

p.strong: In response to the governor’s order to close schools “indefinitely” the EEACS administrative team has developed a school wide plan.

li.a: Executive Education Academy Charter School Continuity of Education Plan
FERPA and COPPA Notice for At-Home Learning
Student Code of Conduct for Distant Learning
School Counseling / School Psychologist / Student Support Resources
Recursos de asesoramiento escolar / Psicólogo escolar / Recursos de apoyo estudiantil de EEACS

a.strong: Attention: All EEACS Employees please click on the Link Below.

p.strong: EXECUTIVE EDUCATION ACADEMY CHARTER SCHOOL ACADEMIC RESOURCES

div.class: fusion-title title fusion-title-1 fusion-sep-none fusion-title-text fusion-title-size-three

h3.h3: Governor Wolf Extends School Closure for the Remainder of Academic Year

div.p: Allentown, PA – Continuing his efforts to protect the health and safety of students and communities during the COVID-19 pandemic, Governor Tom Wolf today announced that all schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year….
div.h4: Hello everyone, our school calendar has been adjusted due to the mandated school closure, We will be in session for virtual instruction Thursday, April 9th and Monday, April 13th. These were originally scheduled as spring break days, however we will only be honoring Good Friday due to the significant amount of instructional time missed.
Comcast is offering their Internet Essentials for free for 2 months. Interested families can use this link to get more information or call 1-855-846-8376.

For folks in the Lehigh Valley, RCN is providing 60-day free Lifeline Internet for K-12 students. Interested adults should call 866-926-6704 to receive additional information about eligibility and request this service.

li.a: Governor Wolf announced that all schools will remain closed until further notice as we work to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 and protect the health of all Pennsylvanians….

As per the governor\\'s order, schools will be closed for the entire school year.
